ovdesc.p: This table is used to setup parameters for calculation of send date in a manner, which can be processed by the payments hub using peeling logic. Send date is the date when an output message has to be sent out to the an entity such as the receiving bank or a clearing.

desc.p: Holds the priority of the payment.
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Indicates the base date on which send date is calculated.
Indicates the number of days which needs to be subtracted or added to SendDateBase to arrive at the send date.
The attribute can have a positive (add days) or negative value (substract days) ranging from +10 to -10.
Indicates the source of the payment.
10 alphanumeric characters. The value links to field 'Source' in PPT.SOURCE.
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.

Holds the output from the bank conditions component which indicates if a payment has to be warehoused or not. Value from this field is used as one of the criteria for selection of a record in the application
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Specifies the Outgoing channel which could be an input in deciding the send date.
The value links to field 'ChannelName' in PPT.CHANNEL.
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Indicates the type of payment for which the send date is calculated.
In cases where payment is settled via a cover message, different send dates are defined for the payment message (103) and the cover message (MT202COV).
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Indicates the currency of the payment and it can be a group of currency as well.
Values are populated from currency table and currency group table.
If left blank, a default value of '*' is set.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
